snippet: An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.2  rattled Northern California's wine country before dawn today, taking place along a previously undiscovered fault line and surprising seismologists.    The epicenter of the earthquake was three miles southwest...
lead_paragraph: An earthquake with a magnitude of 5.2 rattled Northern California's wine country before dawn today, taking place along a previously undiscovered fault line and surprising seismologists. The epicenter of the earthquake was three miles southwest of Yountville, Calif., under Mount Veeders, the most prominent peak in the area.
abstract: Earthquake with magnitude of 5.2 rattles Northern California's wine couuntry, taking place along a previously undiscovered fault line and surprising seismologists; epicenter is three miles southwest of Yountville; several dozen minor injuries are reported, and at least three people suffer more serious injuries when they fall or are hit by falling objects; photo (M)

headline.main: Quake Hits California on New Fault, Startling the Experts
